intro: Axinaea macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf axinaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the cloud forests of western Ecuador and is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which are typically borne on the upper parts of the stems. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 meters. The leaves are革质 (leathery) and have a glossy surface, making it a distinctive and visually appealing plant in its natural habitat.
